wikipedia_page.main: William John Belt (1826-1892) was an English barrister and antiquarian best known for his erratic behaviour in later life which was widely reported by popular newspapapers for the amusement of their readers.

response: * William Belt, barrister and antiquarian, best known for his eccentric behaviour

From 1869 to 1892, 102 Gower Street was the home of the barrister William Belt who was best known for his erratic behaviour in later life which was widely reported by popular newspapapers for the amusement of their readers.
In 1890 he bought Bossall Hall, north of York, from William Belt.
